Def.Name: Mugo Pine
Def.Description: Most planted cultivars are small bushy, round shrubs, 15' - 20' tall. Can get as large as 50'.
Def.Leaves: Evergreen needles, 2 per bundle. 1 1/2" - 2 1/2" long, stiff, meduim to dark green.
Def.Twigs: Short growth, dense foliage, gray-brown buds.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Seed Cones: Small, borne singly or in small cluster, 1" - 2" long, grayish brown at maturity.
Def.Range: Naitive to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, planted as an ornamental in zones 2-7.
Def.Remarks: The needles are know to deter people from entering throught the shrub, because they are so sharp. Used instead of fences and walls.
